thread.title: Reports: Greenland Express to relaunch operations | Finance & Data
thread.title_full: Reports: Greenland Express to relaunch operations | Finance & Data content from ATWOnline

author: Kurt Hofmann
title: Reports: Greenland Express to relaunch operations | Finance & Data
text:
Greenland Express may reportedly relaunch operations between Denmark and Greenland with two leased Sukhoi Superjet 100s (SSJ100s), according to Russia’s Iswestija .
The carrier has canceled all flights between Greenland and Denmark for the remainder of 2015. It said on its website that it is working to provide sustainable solutions to the challenges, which, at present, prevents the company from operating.
No further details on a possible relaunch of flight services are available.
The startup launched flights between Denmark, Greenland and Iceland in June 2014 using a Fokker 100 on wet-lease from Dutch ACMI provider Denim Air, but stopped flying after just three months.
Greenland Express has been granted permission to fly scheduled domestic services within Greenland following a government decision on April 7 this year.
ATW understands it is economically very difficult to operate an airline in Greenland. The population of 56,000 people is decreasing; around 30,000 tourists visit the world largest island. The home market is more or less at a standstill, so any passenger growth must come from the international market. Also, airlines face high taxes and airport fees in Greenland, as well as challenging operations due to harsh weather conditions and weak infrastructure at some airports.
“Our costs are at a very good level and it will be quite hard to compete with us,” Air Greenland CCO Christian Keldsen told ATW during a recent visit in Greenland´s capital Nuuk. He said Air Greenland main competitors are charter companies and Air Iceland, which operate several routes from Iceland to Greenland.
Air Greenland transports around 380,000 passengers per year.
